ideas.title: Add keyboard focus management for ListenDrawer close button
ideas.description: The ListenDrawer (mobile bottom sheet) has no visible close button and relies solely on swipe gestures or clicking outside. Keyboard users have no way to explicitly close the drawer.
ideas.rationale: Bottom drawers opened via button click should return focus to the trigger button on close and provide a keyboard-accessible close mechanism. The drag handle is visual only, not interactive.
ideas.current_state: Drawer has no visible close button. Escape key and hardware back button work, but there's no explicit interactive close element for keyboard navigation.
ideas.proposed_change: Add a visually hidden or icon-only close button in the header area with aria-label='Close'. Ensure Escape key closes drawer AND returns focus to the trigger button that opened it.
ideas.user_benefit: Keyboard and screen reader users can independently close the drawer without relying on indirect methods.

ideas.title: Missing loading/error states in ProfilePrimaryCTA
ideas.description: The ProfilePrimaryCTA component shows a basic loading skeleton when hydrating subscription status but no error state UI when subscription check fails.
ideas.rationale: User actions like opening the notifications CTA could fail silently. Error states should be visible and actionable.
ideas.current_state: Component renders ArtistNotificationsCTA with loading skeleton but no error fallback. If subscription status query fails, user sees stale UI or nothing.
ideas.proposed_change: Add error state UI with retry button when subscription hydration fails. Show inline error message with 'Try again' action.
ideas.user_benefit: Users can recover from temporary network failures without refreshing the entire page.

ideas.title: Hardcoded colors in launch page marketing mockups
ideas.description: The launch page contains extensive hardcoded hex colors and rgb() values in inline styles for marketing mockups instead of using design system tokens.
ideas.rationale: Hardcoded colors create visual inconsistencies, break theming, and make design updates labor-intensive. Memory notes emphasize token usage for consistency.
ideas.current_state: Multiple inline style blocks use hardcoded values like `background: '#2a2a2a'`, `color: 'rgb(52 211 153)'`, `border: '1px solid var(--linear-border-subtle)'` (mixing approaches). Found 24 rgb() usages across launch pages.
ideas.proposed_change: Extract hardcoded colors to CSS variables or Tailwind classes. Use design-system.css tokens (`var(--linear-bg-surface-*)`, `var(--linear-text-*)`) consistently. Consider creating mockup-specific token aliases if needed.
ideas.user_benefit: Consistent visual appearance across light/dark modes, easier design iteration, maintainable codebase.

ideas.title: No mobile preview for profile settings changes
ideas.description: When users edit their profile in dashboard settings, they see changes in desktop view only. No live mobile preview exists despite mobile being the primary consumption device.
ideas.rationale: Most fans view artist profiles on mobile. Artists should preview how changes look on mobile before publishing.
ideas.current_state: Profile preview likely shows desktop layout only (file not read, inferred from common patterns).
ideas.proposed_change: Add mobile/desktop toggle to profile preview. Show iPhone-sized frame with actual mobile layout rendering. Use CSS container queries or responsive iframe.
ideas.user_benefit: Artists can confidently publish changes knowing exactly how fans will see them on phones.

ideas.title: Empty state lacks clear next action for new users
ideas.description: The EmptyState component supports actions, but usage patterns across dashboard may not always provide actionable next steps for first-time users.
ideas.rationale: Empty states are critical onboarding moments. Without clear CTAs, users abandon features.
ideas.current_state: EmptyState component is well-structured with action/secondaryAction props and keyboard shortcuts support. Implementation is solid.
ideas.proposed_change: Audit all EmptyState usages to ensure every instance has a primary action. Add variant-specific default actions (e.g., 'search' variant should default to showing search suggestions, 'permission' should link to settings).
ideas.user_benefit: Users always know what to do next when encountering empty data, reducing abandonment.

ideas.title: Auth flow lacks progress indication across multi-step forms
ideas.description: SignUpForm and SignInForm use multi-step flows (method → email → verification) but only show 'Step X of Y' in AccessibleStepWrapper, not visible progress UI.
ideas.rationale: Users lose context mid-flow and don't know how many steps remain. Visual progress indicators reduce abandonment.
ideas.current_state: AccessibleStepWrapper announces step count for screen readers but provides no visual indicator. Users see form transitions but no progress dots or breadcrumbs.
ideas.proposed_change: Add horizontal step indicator UI (e.g., dots or numbered badges) above form content. Show 'Step 1 of 2' visually, not just in aria-labels. Highlight current step, gray out future steps.
ideas.user_benefit: Users understand where they are in the auth flow and feel confident they're making progress.

ideas.title: Missing 'Remember me' and biometric login options
ideas.description: Auth flows lack 'Remember me' checkbox or passkey/biometric auth options. Users must re-enter credentials frequently.
ideas.rationale: Modern auth UX expectations include passkeys, Face ID, Touch ID. Clerk supports these but Jovie doesn't expose them.
ideas.current_state: Auth shows Google/Spotify OAuth and email options only. No passkey or biometric options visible.
ideas.proposed_change: Add 'Sign in with passkey' option if user has saved credentials. Show Face ID/Touch ID icon on supported devices. Use Clerk's passkey APIs.
ideas.user_benefit: Faster login, better security, matches user expectations from modern apps.

ideas.title: No visual feedback for clipboard copy actions
ideas.description: Launch page and dashboard likely have copy-to-clipboard actions (smart links, profile URLs) but may lack success feedback.
ideas.rationale: Users need confirmation their action succeeded. Without feedback, they may click multiple times or paste wrong content.
ideas.current_state: Inferred from typical patterns — clipboard actions may show no visual feedback.
ideas.proposed_change: Add toast notification or inline 'Copied!' message on successful copy. Change button icon from copy → checkmark for 2 seconds. Use subtle animation.
ideas.user_benefit: Users confidently know their link was copied and don't second-guess the action.

ideas.title: AuthLayout footer hidden on keyboard open causes navigation loss
ideas.description: AuthLayout hides footer links ('Don't have access? Join waitlist') when mobile keyboard opens, removing navigation options mid-flow.
ideas.rationale: If user wants to switch from sign-in to waitlist during verification step, they can't access the footer link while keyboard is visible.
ideas.current_state: Line 218 conditionally hides footer when `isKeyboardVisible`. Footer contains actionable links that become inaccessible.
ideas.proposed_change: Keep footer visible but reduce padding/size when keyboard open. Or add sticky navigation bar at top with back/alternative action buttons that remain visible.
ideas.user_benefit: Users can change their mind mid-flow without closing keyboard or going back.

ideas.title: Pricing page lacks visual hierarchy for Pro plan (recommended)
ideas.description: Pricing page shows three plans equally. Pro plan has stronger border but no 'Recommended' or 'Most Popular' badge.
ideas.rationale: Decision paralysis is real. Highlighting the intended tier guides users toward optimal choice.
ideas.current_state: Pro plan has `border-strong` and `hover:border-white/[0.12]` but no badge or scale emphasis.
ideas.proposed_change: Add 'Most Popular' badge to Pro plan header. Optionally increase scale (105%) or add subtle glow effect. Use accent color for badge.
ideas.user_benefit: Users make faster decisions with clear guidance on best value.

ideas.title: Mobile drawer scrolling conflicts with page scroll on iOS Safari
ideas.description: ListenDrawer uses Vaul for bottom sheet but may exhibit scroll locking issues on iOS where background scrolls while drawer is open.
ideas.rationale: Common iOS bug where body scroll isn't prevented when modal/drawer opens. Causes jarring UX and accidental dismissals.
ideas.current_state: Drawer uses `overscroll-contain` on content div but may not lock body scroll on iOS Safari.
ideas.proposed_change: Add `overflow: hidden` to document.body when drawer opens. Use useEffect to toggle on mount/unmount. Preserve scroll position to prevent jump.
ideas.user_benefit: Smooth mobile experience without background scroll interference.

ideas.title: Loading skeleton animation respects prefers-reduced-motion but components may not
ideas.description: Design system CSS has prefers-reduced-motion support but individual components may use custom animations without motion checks.
ideas.rationale: Accessibility requirement: users with vestibular disorders must be able to disable animations.
ideas.current_state: Some components have motion-reduce support (line 267 in HeroSpotifySearch uses `motion-reduce:animate-none`), but logo spin animation in AuthLayout and marketing page animations may not respect preference.
ideas.proposed_change: Audit all CSS animations and framer-motion usages. Add `@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce)` overrides or `motion-reduce:` Tailwind classes. Use useReducedMotion hook consistently.
ideas.user_benefit: Accessible experience for users with motion sensitivity or vestibular disorders.

ideas.title: HeroSpotifySearch dropdown has no max-height causing viewport overflow
ideas.description: Spotify search results dropdown uses `max-h-64` but with 5+ results plus 'paste URL' option, mobile devices may see clipped results or awkward scrolling.
ideas.rationale: Mobile viewports are short. Tall dropdowns push action buttons off-screen and cause nested scroll confusion.
ideas.current_state: Dropdown div has `max-h-64` (256px) which fits ~6 results. May overflow on small mobile screens.
ideas.proposed_change: Use dynamic max-height based on viewport: `max-h-[40vh]` or `max-h-[min(16rem,40vh)]` to adapt to device height. Ensure clear scroll affordance.
ideas.user_benefit: Usable search on all screen sizes without content clipping.

ideas.title: No error recovery flow for failed Spotify import
ideas.description: If Spotify import fails during signup, user may be stuck with no clear path to retry or manually enter data.
ideas.rationale: Network failures happen. Users should be able to retry or bypass the failed step without abandoning signup.
ideas.current_state: Search shows 'error' state with 'Search failed. Try again.' message but no retry button. User must re-type query.
ideas.proposed_change: Add 'Retry' button in error state that re-executes last query. Provide 'Skip Spotify import' option to proceed manually. Preserve user's progress.
ideas.user_benefit: Resilient signup flow that handles network issues gracefully.

ideas.title: Dashboard skeleton lacks semantic structure
ideas.description: DashboardOverviewSkeleton uses LoadingSkeleton atoms but doesn't convey content structure to screen readers during loading.
ideas.rationale: Screen reader users hear generic 'loading skeleton' but don't know what's being loaded (metrics? tasks? profile?).
ideas.current_state: Skeleton has `aria-busy='true'` and `aria-live='polite'` on container, but inner sections lack aria-labels to describe content type.
ideas.proposed_change: Add `aria-label='Loading metrics'` to metrics section, `aria-label='Loading tasks'` to task section. Use `<section>` with labels instead of generic divs.
ideas.user_benefit: Screen reader users understand what's loading and can anticipate content structure.

ideas.title: AuthButton active:scale transform may conflict with haptic timing
ideas.description: AuthButton applies `active:scale-[0.98]` transform AND triggers haptic feedback on press. Visual and haptic feedback may feel misaligned on slow devices.
ideas.rationale: Haptic should sync with visual press state for cohesive tactile experience.
ideas.current_state: Button has `active:scale-[0.98]` CSS and `haptic.light()` call in onClick. Transform is instant, haptic may lag on slow devices.
ideas.proposed_change: Trigger haptic in onTouchStart or onPointerDown instead of onClick to sync with visual transform. Test on low-end Android devices.
ideas.user_benefit: Cohesive, responsive feeling on button press across all devices.

ideas.title: Email verification OTP inputs lack paste support
ideas.description: Verification step likely uses individual OTP input fields. Users can't paste 6-digit codes from SMS/email, forcing manual entry.
ideas.rationale: Mobile keyboards auto-suggest OTP codes. Paste support is table stakes for modern auth UX.
ideas.current_state: File not fully read, but VerificationStep exists. Likely uses OTP input component.
ideas.proposed_change: Ensure OTP input supports paste. When user pastes 6-digit code, auto-distribute across inputs and submit. Use `autocomplete='one-time-code'` for iOS autofill.
ideas.user_benefit: Faster verification, fewer typos, better mobile UX.

ideas.title: Marketing page lacks skip-to-content links
ideas.description: Launch page has no skip navigation link for keyboard users to bypass repeated hero content when tabbing.
ideas.rationale: WCAG 2.4.1 requires bypass blocks. Long marketing pages force keyboard users to tab through entire hero and nav every time.
ideas.current_state: Page has multiple sections but no skip-to-main-content link. AuthLayout has one (line 132-138), but marketing pages don't.
ideas.proposed_change: Add `Skip to main content` at top of page. Ensure #main-content target exists.
ideas.user_benefit: Keyboard users can quickly navigate to primary content without tabbing through hero.

ideas.title: No visible focus indicators on custom dropdown options
ideas.description: HeroSpotifySearch renders custom dropdown with button elements for artist results. Focus styles may not be visible enough on dark backgrounds.
ideas.rationale: WCAG 2.4.7 requires visible focus indicators. Users need to see which result is focused when arrowing through list.
ideas.current_state: Dropdown results use `tabIndex={0}` and highlight on `activeIndex`, but no explicit focus-visible ring. Uses hover background only.
ideas.proposed_change: Add `focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-focus` to result buttons. Ensure hover state and focus state are distinct (different colors or ring vs background).
ideas.user_benefit: Keyboard users can see which result they're about to select.

ideas.title: Inconsistent button sizing across auth forms
ideas.description: AuthButton defines `min-h-[44px]` for touch targets but other interactive elements in auth flow may not meet 44px minimum.
ideas.rationale: iOS and Android guidelines require 44-48px touch targets. Inconsistent sizing causes missed taps.
ideas.current_state: AuthButton uses `h-11 min-h-[44px]` which is correct. Other buttons/links in auth may use smaller heights.
ideas.proposed_change: Audit all clickable elements in auth flow. Ensure links, text buttons, icon buttons all meet 44px minimum. Add padding if needed.
ideas.user_benefit: Easier mobile interaction, fewer missed taps, better accessibility.

key_themes: Accessibility gaps: missing focus management, reduced motion support, screen reader context
Mobile UX issues: keyboard handling, scroll conflicts, touch target sizing
Auth flow polish: progress indication, error recovery, paste support for OTP
Design system adoption: hardcoded colors in marketing pages need token migration
Missing feedback: loading states, error states, clipboard copy confirmation
quick_wins: uiux-001: Add close button to ListenDrawer (high priority, low effort)
uiux-017: Enable OTP paste support (high priority, low effort)
uiux-018: Add skip-to-content links (high priority, low effort)
uiux-019: Improve focus indicators on dropdowns (high priority, low effort)
summary.notes: Analysis focused on recently modified auth components, launch/pricing pages, and profile UX. Many findings relate to accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1) and modern mobile UX expectations. Design system token adoption is strong overall but marketing pages have regression with hardcoded colors. Previous ideation findings (duplicate Analytics nav, music CTA replaced by subscription form) are still valid but not duplicated here.
